light.definition: Class to represent all the Light system individuals.

window.definition: Class to represent all the Window system individuals.

thermostat.definition: Class to represent all the Thermostat system individuals.

hvac.definition: Class to represent all the HVAC system individuals.

equipment.definition: Class to represent equipments the occupant interact with but do not influence the environment. These systems also contribute in the energy performance analysis.

controltype.definition: Class to represent control types in systems

identifier.definition: A unique identifier for this children

shade.definition: Class to represent all the Shade system individuals.

system.definition: System refer to the equipment or mechanisms within the building with which occupants may interact with to restore or maintain environmental comfort.

schedule.definition: N-ary class to represent the duration, start time and end time of an event.

meeting.definition: Class to represent a meeting inside a communal space.

spacetype.definition: Class to represent the type of building space.

identifier.definition: A unique identifier for this children

space.definition: Class to represent the different spaces the building have and where the occupant behaviors occur.

buildingtype.definition: Class to represent types of buildings

identifier.definition: A unique identifier for this children

building.definition: Building where the occupancy behaviors occur.

occupantName.definition: The official name or set of names, expressed as text, by which this person is known in its identity documents.

occupantAge.definition: A measure of the age of this person such as his/her age at a particular point in time.

identifier.definition: A unique identifier for this children

occupantJobtype.definition: A description of the job / occupation of the specific occupant.

occupantGender.definition: The male or female sex, or the state of being either male or female.

occupantLifestyle.definition: A description of the way of living of the specific occupant.

movementmodel.definition: Model to define ocuppants movements inside a space

movement.definition: The Movement class is used to represent the occupants movements inside a space.

interactionformula.definition: Formula to model the probability of interaction between ocupant and system.

interaction.definition: The Interaction class represents the interaction of the occupant with the systems within the space to recover its comfort.

report.definition: The Report class indicates that an occupant seeks assistance or files a complaint about their personal discomfort, but does not take direct action to satisfy their needs.

inaction.definition: The Inaction class represents the decision of an occupant to not act and remain uncomfortable within a space.

action.definition: Actions are the interactions with systems or activities that occupants can perform to achieve environmental comfort.

light.definition: Class to represent all the Light system individuals.

window.definition: Class to represent all the Window system individuals.

thermostat.definition: Class to represent all the Thermostat system individuals.

hvac.definition: Class to represent all the HVAC system individuals.

equipment.definition: Class to represent equipments the occupant interact with but do not influence the environment. These systems also contribute in the energy performance analysis.

controltype.definition: Class to represent control types in systems

identifier.definition: A unique identifier for this children

shade.definition: Class to represent all the Shade system individuals.

system.definition: System refer to the equipment or mechanisms within the building with which occupants may interact with to restore or maintain environmental comfort.

identifier.definition: A unique identifier for this children

nonphysicalneed.definition: Non physical comfort need that could lead to a behavior, such as privacy, schedule, etc.

thermalneed.definition: Class to represent thermal comfort requirements.

iaqneed.definition: Class to represent IAQ comfort requirements.

accousticneed.definition: Class to represent accoustic comfort requirements.

visualneed.definition: Class to represent visual comfort requirements.

physicalneed.definition: Physical comfort need that could lead to a behavior.

need.definition: Needs represent the physical and non-physical requirements of the occupant that must be met in order to ensure satisfaction with their environment.

event.definition: Class to represent events inside a space.

light.definition: Class to represent all the Light system individuals.

window.definition: Class to represent all the Window system individuals.

thermostat.definition: Class to represent all the Thermostat system individuals.

hvac.definition: Class to represent all the HVAC system individuals.

equipment.definition: Class to represent equipments the occupant interact with but do not influence the environment. These systems also contribute in the energy performance analysis.

controltype.definition: Class to represent control types in systems

identifier.definition: A unique identifier for this children

shade.definition: Class to represent all the Shade system individuals.

system.definition: System refer to the equipment or mechanisms within the building with which occupants may interact with to restore or maintain environmental comfort.

schedule.definition: N-ary class to represent the duration, start time and end time of an event.

meeting.definition: Class to represent a meeting inside a communal space.

spacetype.definition: Class to represent the type of building space.

identifier.definition: A unique identifier for this children

space.definition: Class to represent the different spaces the building have and where the occupant behaviors occur.

spatial.definition: Class to represent behaviors caused by the space itself.

timeofday.definition: Class to represent a particular time during the day.

season.definition: Class to represent the seasons of the year

dayofweek.definition: Class to represent all the days of the week

drivertime.definition: N-ary class to define the time, day and season when a specific driver occurs.

identifier.definition: A unique identifier for this children

environmentparameter.definition: Class that represent a physical variable of the environment where the driver occurs. It could represent variables that impact directly on the comfort levels of the occupant.

environment.definition: Class to represent the environmental physical conditions that could be causing the occupant behavior.

drivers.definition: Drivers represent the environmental factors that stimulate occupants to fulfill a physical, physiological or psychological need.

behavior.definition: Class that represent the behaviour of the occupant.
